1.text: And Jehovah will answer Job from the whirlwind, and he will say,

2.text: Who this darkening counsel in words without knowledge?

3.text: Gird now thy loins as a man; and I will ask thee, and make thou known to me.

4.text: Where wert thou in my founding the earth? Announce, if thou knewest understanding.

5.text: Who set its measures, if thou shalt know? or who stretched the line upon it?

6.text: Upon what were its bases impressed? or who placed its corner-stone?

7.text: In the rejoicing together of the stars of morning, and all the sons of God will shout for joy?

8.text: And he will hedge in the sea with doors in its breaking forth, going forth from the womb.

9.text: In my making the cloud its garment, and darkness its bandage:

10.text: And I shall break upon it my law, and I shall set bars and doors;

11.text: And saying, Even to this shalt thou come, and thou shalt not add: and here in the pride of thy waves, stand thou.

12.text: In thy days didst thou command the morning? and didst thou make the dawning know its place?

13.text: To take hold upon the wings of the earth, and the unjust shall be shaken out of it?

14.text: It shall be turned as clay to the seal; and they shall stand as clothing.

15.text: And their light shall be withheld from the unjust, and the high arm shall be broken.

16.text: Didst thou go even to the fountains of the sea? and didst thou go about in searching the depth?

17.text: Were the gates of death uncovered to thee? and shalt thou see the gates of the shadow of death?

18.text: Wilt thou consider even to the breadth of the earth? Announce if thou knewest all of it.

19.text: Where the way light shall dwell? and darkness, where its place?

20.text: That thou shalt take it to its bound, and that thou shalt understand the beaten paths of its house?

21.text: Knewest thou? for shalt thou then be born, and the number of thy days great?

22.text: Didst thou come into the treasures of snow? and shalt thou see the treasures of hail,

23.text: Which I kept back for the time of straits, for the day of encounter and war?

24.text: Where that way the light will divide, it will scatter the east wind upon the earth?

25.text: Who divided a channel for the overflowing, and a way for the lightning of the voices?

26.text: To cause it to rain upon the earth, not a man; the wilderness not a man in it?

27.text: To satisfy the desolation and burning, and to cause the springing up of the finding of the tender grass?

28.text: Is there a father to the rain? or who begat the reservoirs of the dew?

29.text: From whose womb came forth the ice? and the hoarfrost of the heavens, who brought it forth?

30.text: The waters shall be hid as a stone, and the face of the depth will be taken.

31.text: Wilt thou bind the bands of the cluster, or wilt thou open the cords of Orion?

32.text: Wilt thou bring forth the twelve signs in its time? and the great bear and his sons, wilt thou guide them?

33.text: Knewest thou the laws of the heavens? or wilt thou set up its dominion in the earth?

34.text: Wilt thou lift up thy voice to the cloud, and abundance of waters shall cover thee?

35.text: Shalt thou send lightnings, and shall they go and shall they say to thee, Behold us?

36.text: Who put wisdom in the reins? or who gave understanding to the mind?

37.text: Who shall number the clouds in wisdom? and who shall cause the bottles of heaven to lie down?

38.text: In the pouring out of the dust into a melted mass, and the clods will adhere.

39.text: Wilt thou hunt the prey for the lion? and wilt thou fill up the life of the young lions?

40.text: For they will sink down in the dwellings; they will dwell in the thicket to lie in wait.

41.text: Who will prepare for the raven his food? for his young will cry to God; they will wander without food.
